instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MB with an issue with not showing a picture every time, and it usually happens when the battery is plugged in. There was some corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C4905</CAPACITOR> together with <RESISTOR>R5076</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5075</RESISTOR>, but I took care of that and also on the <RESISTOR>R3655</RESISTOR> area but all resoldered. 

Once I plug in the battery it won't show a picture, even with just the MB and LCD still doesn't show a picture, so I have to leave it for some time to drain and then it shows every time when just MB and LCD. I was suspecting <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> in the beginning, but now I'm not sure. <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> it's clean and no corrosion near it. I have also resoldered and checked all contacts on J9000.

Any ideas? Thanks

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
I tried but it didn't work also i replaced it cause the original <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> was overheating, some damaged contacts on it, which I rewired but didn't work. I solved it by turning off the GPU, to work only on the Intel, just the brightness it's stuck at 100%. 

Thanks for the assistance
